data.content: Generate the content of the top-level.yaml file for a pizzeria chatbot. This should be a menu-type module called top-level, acting as the main entry point. Include a presentation field with a welcome message and function description. In items, create: a greeting answer, a pizza_qa module, and an order_flow module for orders. Also, add a fallback message if the user is not understood. Return only the YAML code.

Here is the complete content for the `top-level.yaml` file for your pizzeria chatbot. This file defines the main entry point of the chatbot, including a welcome message, a pizza Q&A module, and an order flow module.

```yaml
# -----> File: top_level.yaml <-----
modules:
- name: top-level
  kind: menu
  presentation: |
    Welcome to our pizzeria chatbot! I'm here to assist you with your pizza orders and answer any questions you may have about our menu. 
    Feel free to ask me anything about our pizzas or how to place an order.
  fallback: I'm sorry, I did not understand that. Could you please rephrase your question?

  items:
  - title: Greeting
    kind: answer
    answer: |
      Hello! Welcome to our pizzeria. How can I help you today?
  - title: Pizza Q&A
    kind: module
    reference: pizza_qa
  - title: Order Flow
    kind: module
    reference: order_flow
```

Make sure to replace the `pizza_qa` and `order_flow` references with the actual module names you will define for those functionalities. Let me know if you need further assistance!
